alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 1:56PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Converse County through 230 PM MDT... At 155 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Laprele Reservoir, or 15 miles west of Douglas, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Douglas and Laprele Reservoir. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 126 and 157. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; North Laramie Range
